marketNews.title: Powell Signals Slowdown in Interest Rate Cuts
marketNews.content: The Fed Head, Jerome Powell, said on Thursday (11/14) that there is no need to rush to lower interest rates as the current economic conditions are very good. Powell's statement came just one day after the release of US inflation data for October 2024, which rose to 2.6% YoY (vs. September 2024: 2.4% YoY inflation), ending the 6-month trend of declining inflation. Powell affirmed that the Fed still considers inflation to be on a sustainable path towards the 2% target level, allowing the US central bank to move interest rates toward a more neutral level, which neither stimulates nor restricts economic growth. Nevertheless, what that more neutral interest rate level is, and how quickly the Fed will achieve it, remains unknown. On the other hand, future US economic growth and inflation rates face uncertainty from the protectionist policies hinted at by the elected president, Donald Trump. Following Powell's less dovish statement, analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool shows that the probability of the Fed cutting interest rates by 25 bps at the December 2024 meeting sharply decreased, from 82.5% on November 13, 2024, to only 58.9% as of Friday (11/15). In line with this, the probability of a Fed interest rate cut of >=75 bps until June 2025 also dropped from 47% to 34% in the last week, while the probability of an interest rate cut of <75 bps until June 2025 increased from 53% to 66%. On Thursday (11/14), US stock exchanges collectively weakened, with S&P (-0.60%), Nasdaq (-0.64%), and DJI (-0.47%). The US Dollar Index (DXY) also strengthened (+0.09%) on Thursday (11/14), although it weakened by -0.1% to 15,855 by this afternoon, Friday (11/15), mainly supported by Bank Indonesia's intervention. The Governor of the Monetary Management and Securities Asset Department of Bank Indonesia, Edi Susianto, told Bloomberg that the fundamental level of the Rupiah is stronger than 16,000 per US dollar. Key Takeaway: A slower/smaller Fed interest rate cut in 2025 could reduce the room for Bank Indonesia to lower the BI Rate. As of today, the consensus gathered by Bloomberg projects that Bank Indonesia will cut rates by -100 bps until the end of 2025. From a market aspect, although foreign outflow from the IHSG continued today since Trump's victory, we observe that its value started to shrink to 517 billion rupiah. This decrease in outflow value might indicate that the majority of selling pressure has been realized (priced-in).

marketNews.title: Trade Balance Surplus Decreases in October 2024
marketNews.content: Indonesia's trade balance surplus decreased to 2.47 billion US dollars in October 2024 (vs. October 2023: 3.47 billion US dollars, September 2024: 3.23 billion US dollars), falling below consensus expectations which projected a surplus of 3.05 billion US dollars. This result marks a surplus for 54 consecutive months, although it is the smallest since June 2024. The surplus decline was pressured by a higher increase in imports (+17.49% YoY) compared to export growth (+10.25% YoY). Throughout 10M24, Indonesia's trade balance surplus reached 34.04 billion US dollars (vs. 10M23: 31.22 billion US dollars), with exports and imports growing by +1.33% YoY and +5.25% YoY, respectively.

marketNews.title: EU Parliament Demands Further Changes to Deforestation Rules
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the European Parliament on Thursday (11/14) demanded further changes to the substance of anti-deforestation legislation. This move follows an amendment request from its largest political group, the European People's Party, to soften the regulation. This demand is in addition to the proposal to postpone implementation by 12 months until the end of 2025. Bloomberg reported that if an amendment agreement is not formalized by the deadline, the anti-deforestation regulation risks being implemented starting December 30, 2024, without any changes.

marketNews.title: China's Retail Sales Rebounded in October 2024
marketNews.content: China's national statistics bureau noted that retail sales in China increased by +4.8% YoY in October 2024 (vs. September 2024: +3.2% YoY), exceeding consensus expectations which forecasted +3.8% YoY. This result marks the highest growth since February 2024, driven by a week-long holiday moment, shopping festivals, and a series of stimulus measures provided by the Chinese government in late September 2024 to boost demand.

marketNews.title: China's New Home Prices and Real Estate Investment Declined in October 2024
marketNews.content: China's national statistics bureau noted that new home prices in 70 cities in China fell by -5.9% YoY in October 2024 (vs. September 2024: -5.8% YoY). This result marks the 16th consecutive month of decline and the deepest contraction since April 2015, despite the Chinese government continuing efforts to mitigate the impact of the property sector slowdown through mortgage rate reductions and cutting home purchase costs. Furthermore, real estate investment also recorded a decline of -10.3% YoY (vs. September 2024: -10.1% YoY), marking the deepest decline since August 2021.

marketNews.title: China's Industrial Production Growth Slowed in October 2024
marketNews.content: China's national statistics bureau noted that industrial production in China grew by +5.3% YoY in October 2024 (vs. September 2024: +5.4% YoY), below the consensus expectation of +5.6% YoY. On a monthly basis, China's industrial production grew by +0.41% MoM in October 2024 (vs. September 2024: +0.59% MoM). Cumulatively over 10M24, China's industrial production grew by +5.8% YoY (vs. 10M23: +4.1% YoY).

marketNews.title: ESDM Minister Plans LPG Plant Investment Early 2025
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated that the investment plan for building a liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) plant will begin in January 2025. Bahlil mentioned that the government and SKK Migas are currently finalizing the concept for the plant, which is planned to have a production capacity of around 1.5-2 million tons per year. The LPG plant construction plan aims to reduce import dependency, where Bahlil explained that total LPG consumption in Indonesia reaches 8 million tons per year, while production is only 1.9 million tons per year.

tickerNews.title: FREN Secures Syndicated Loan Up to IDR 10 Trillion
tickerNews.content: $FREN: Smartfren Telecom and its subsidiary, PT Smart Telecom (Smartel), signed a syndicated loan agreement of up to 10 trillion rupiah from 6 banks, with Bank Central Asia ($BBCA) and PT Sarana Multi Infrastruktur acting as the mandated lead arranger and bookrunner. The funds will be used for refinancing the company's and Smartel's existing credit facility loans, financing the spectrum auction for frequency bands, and capital expenditure for the company and/or Smartel. This loan facility has a tenor of 7 years with an interest rate of 3-month JIBOR + a certain margin. FREN explained that this syndicated loan agreement has a more competitive interest rate compared to existing credit facilities, and the company and Smartel will obtain additional funds for capital expenditure in the context of network development and service improvement.

tickerNews.title: ANTM Taps China Lead Arranger for EV Battery Ecosystem Syndicated Loan
tickerNews.content: $ANTM: Aneka Tambang Director, I Dewa Wirantaya, stated that the company has appointed a lead arranger from China to prepare a syndicated loan related to the electric vehicle battery ecosystem project worth 6 billion US dollars. This project will be carried out by a consortium consisting of ANTM, Battery Corporation (IBC), and CATL's subsidiary, CBL International Development Pte. Ltd. Dewa mentioned that 60% of the project funding will come from loans, with the remainder coming from capital injections by each consortium member. Dewa mentioned that the syndicated loan is expected to be realized by the end of 2024, so that the first phase of construction can begin in 2025.

tickerNews.title: TOBA Aims for Tembesi Floating Solar Power Plant to Operate Commercially in 2025
tickerNews.content: $TOBA: TBS Energi Utama Investor Relations, Nafi Achmad Sentausa, stated that the company is targeting the floating solar power plant (PLTS) project in Tembesi, Batam, to commence commercial operation in 2025. The floating solar power plant has an electricity production capacity of 46 MWp and has signed a 25-year power purchase agreement with PLN Batam. Nafi also mentioned that TOBA is exploring new investment plans to develop its new and renewable energy (EBT) portfolio and waste management following the divestment of 2 coal-fired power plant (PLTU) assets, PT Minahasa Cahaya Lestari and PT Gorontalo Listrik, worth 144.8 million US dollars. The divestment was approved in an Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on Thursday (11/14).

tickerNews.title: MLBI to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2024 Books
tickerNews.content: $MLBI: Multi Bintang Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 book year amounting to 400.3 billion rupiah or 190 rupiah per share. The cum date on the regular and negotiation markets is November 22, 2024, with payment on December 12, 2024. Referring to MLBI's stock price at the market close on Friday (11/15) at 6,400 rupiah per share, the implied dividend yield is 3%.

tickerNews.title: ISAT CEO Vikram Sinha Acquires Shares
tickerNews.content: $ISAT: Indosat President Director, Vikram Sinha, purchased 921,900 ISAT shares at an average price of 2,166 rupiah per share on November 11, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 2 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Vikram's ownership in ISAT increased from 0.0064% to 0.0092%.

tickerNews.title: SMIL Controller Acquired More Shares
tickerNews.content: $SMIL: The controller and President Director of Sarana Mitra Luas, Hadi Suhermin, purchased 87.4 million SMIL shares at a price of 172 rupiah per share on November 12, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 15 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Hadi Suhermin's ownership in SMIL increased from 48% to 49%.

tickerNews.title: HUMI Subsidiary Acquires Oil Tanker Vessel
tickerNews.content: $HUMI: Humpuss Maritim Internasional, through its subsidiary, PT Hutama Trans Kontinental, acquired one oil tanker vessel for 65.5 billion rupiah from a non-affiliated party, PT Maritim Indo Trans. This transaction was financed using bank funding and internal cash.

tickerNews.title: GIAA Shareholders Approve New President Director
tickerNews.content: Garuda Indonesia ($GIAA) shareholders on Friday (11/15) approved the appointment of Wamildan Tsani Panjaitan as the company's President Director, replacing Irfan Setiaputra. Previously, Wamildan served as the acting President Director at PT Lion Air since 2023.

tickerNews.title: Jakarta Gubernatorial Candidates Propose Closing DLTA Factory
tickerNews.content: The candidate pair for Governor and Vice Governor of Jakarta, Ridwan Kamil-Suswono, stated they would close the alcoholic beverage factory, Delta Djakarta ($DLTA), if elected in the regional head elections (pilkada). This promise is part of a 16-point integrity pact between Ridwan Kamil-Suswono and representatives of Jakarta's clergy and figures. Besides closing the factory, one point of the integrity pact also includes the complete revocation of the Jakarta Provincial Government's share ownership in DLTA.
